Authors: Li Jin, Hayato Masuya, Izumi Okane, Yuichi Yamaoka
Title:
A new species of the Ophiostoma piceae complex associated
with bark beetles infesting Japanese larch in Japan
Abstract:
A new species in the Ophiostoma piceae complex was
isolated from bark beetles and beetle galleries infesting Japanese larch
in Japan, and was described as Ophiostoma gracile. Phylogenetic analyses
of the internal transcribed spacer (ITS) of the nuclear ribosomal RNA
genes (rDNA) region, partial β-tubulin, and elongation factor-1α gene
revealed that O. gracile was clearly separated from other species of the
O. piceae complex. The sexual morph of O. gracile morphologically
resembled O. breviusculum, but was clearly distinguishable based on
morphological characteristics of the synnema, such as the color and
shape of the stipe. Mating compatibility tests indicated that there is
some degree of reproductive isolation between O. gracile and O. piceae,
O. breviusculum, and O. subalpinum.
